```diff
+ # 01 - Agno Coordination Pattern
+ 
+ ## Overview
+ 
+ This is the **foundational multi-agent pattern** that demonstrates sequential task coordination. A team leader delegates tasks to specialized agents one by one, gathers their reports, and synthesizes a comprehensive recommendation.
+ 
+ This is the most straightforward multi-agent pattern - think of it like a manager who delegates tasks to team members sequentially and compiles their individual reports.
+ 
+ ## Key Characteristics
+ 
+ - **Sequential Delegation**: Leader delegates to one agent at a time
+ - **Independent Work**: Each agent works without knowledge of other agents&#39; results
+ - **Centralized Synthesis**: Team leader combines all reports at the end
+ - **No Inter-Agent Discussion**: Agents don&#39;t debate or influence each other
+ 
+ ## Architecture
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+ â”‚              Team Leader (Coordinator)               â”‚
+ â”‚  - Validates user has provided all info             â”‚
+ â”‚  - Delegates tasks sequentially                     â”‚
+ â”‚  - Synthesizes final recommendation                 â”‚
+ â”‚  - Generates comprehensive report                   â”‚
+ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+                           â”‚
+                           â”‚ Sequential delegation
+                           â”‚
+         â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

+ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

+         â”‚                 â”‚                 â”‚
+         â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+                           â”‚
+                           â–¼
+               Individual Reports Generated
+                           â”‚
+                           â–¼
+             Team Leader Synthesizes Results
+                           â”‚
+                           â–¼
+               Final Recommendation + Report
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Specialized Agents
+ 
+ ### 1. **Cost Analyst**
+ - **Role**: Analyzes cost of living differences
+ - **Data Source**: Real-time scraping from NerdWallet Cost of Living Calculator
+ - **Tool**: &#96;get_cost_of_living_comparison()&#96; - Uses Firecrawl to scrape actual data
+ - **Output**: &#96;CostAnalysis&#96; (housing, transportation, food, taxes, key insights)
+ - **Features**:
+   - City database matching (200+ US cities)
+   - Fuzzy matching for city names (handles &quot;NYC&quot; â†’ &quot;New York (Manhattan), NY&quot;)
+   - URL formatting for NerdWallet comparisons
+   - Real percentage differences and dollar amounts
+ 
+ ### 2. **Sentiment Analyst**
+ - **Role**: Researches city vibe, culture, and livability
+ - **Data Source**: General knowledge about cities
+ - **Output**: &#96;SentimentAnalysis&#96; (vibe, livability score, pros/cons)
+ - **Considers**: User&#39;s stated preferences and values
+ 
+ ### 3. **Migration Researcher**
+ - **Role**: Finds real-world experiences from people who made similar moves
+ - **Data Source**: Reddit discussions via Brave Search API
+ - **Tool**: &#96;search_reddit_discussions()&#96; - Custom integration
+ - **Output**: &#96;MigrationInsights&#96; (common reasons, challenges, outcomes, warnings)
+ - **Features**:
+   - Multiple query variations for comprehensive search
+   - Real Reddit thread analysis
+   - Direct quotes and themes from Redditors
+ 
+ ## Real Data Integration
+ 
+ ### âœ… Implemented: NerdWallet Cost Data
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Automatically fetches and parses real cost comparison
+ get_cost_of_living_comparison(current_city=&quot;Austin&quot;, desired_city=&quot;Seattle&quot;)
+ 
+ # Output includes:
+ # - Overall cost difference percentage
+ # - Housing costs (rent, utilities)
+ # - Transportation costs (transit, gas, car ownership)
+ # - Food and grocery costs
+ # - Entertainment costs
+ # - Healthcare costs
+ # - Tax implications
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Console output shows the scraping process:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ ğŸ” [COST TOOL] Fetching real cost of living data...
+    Current City: Austin
+    â”œâ”€ Matched to: Austin, TX
+    â””â”€ URL format: austin-tx
+    Desired City: Seattle
+    â”œâ”€ Matched to: Seattle, WA
+    â””â”€ URL format: seattle-wa
+    URL: https://www.nerdwallet.com/cost-of-living-calculator/compare/austin-tx-vs-seattle-wa
+    â³ Scraping data with Firecrawl...
+ 
+ âœ… [COST TOOL] Successfully retrieved cost of living data!
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### âœ… Implemented: Reddit Search via Brave
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Searches Reddit for migration experiences
+ search_reddit_discussions(current_city=&quot;Austin&quot;, desired_city=&quot;Seattle&quot;)
+ 
+ # Automatically tries multiple query patterns:
+ # - &quot;moving from Austin to Seattle reddit&quot;
+ # - &quot;relocated Austin to Seattle experience&quot;
+ # - &quot;moved from Austin to Seattle&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Returns formatted results with:
+ - Thread titles
+ - Subreddits
+ - Descriptions/snippets
+ - Direct URLs
+ 
+ ## Information Gathering Flow
+ 
+ The application uses a conversational agent to gather comprehensive user information:
+ 
+ 1. **Initial Freeform Input**: User describes their situation naturally
+ 2. **Intelligent Follow-up**: Agent asks targeted questions for missing info
+ 3. **Priority Order**:
+    - Specific city names (handles boroughs, metro areas)
+    - Financial information (income + expenses)
+    - Preferences and current city opinions
+ 4. **Validation**: Ensures cities are specific before proceeding
+ 
+ ### Example Interaction
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Tell me about your move consideration: I&#39;m thinking about moving from New York to Miami
```

```diff
+ â–°â–°â–°â–±â–±â–±â–± Analyzing your response...

+

+

+

+

+ 
+ â–°â–°â–°â–°â–°â–°â–° Finalizing your profile...
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Pydantic Data Models
+ 
+ The application uses strongly-typed Pydantic models for all data:
+ 
+ ### Core Models
+ - **&#96;UserProfile&#96;**: Financial info, preferences, city opinions
+ - **&#96;CostAnalysis&#96;**: Structured cost comparison data
+ - **&#96;SentimentAnalysis&#96;**: City vibe and livability metrics
+ - **&#96;MigrationInsights&#96;**: Real migration experiences
+ - **&#96;FinalRecommendation&#96;**: Comprehensive decision with justification
+ 
+ All agents use &#96;output_schema&#96; to ensure consistent, structured responses.
+ 
+ ## Usage
+ 
+ ### Prerequisites
+ 
+ 1. **Python Environment**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ python -m venv venv
+ source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 2. **Install Dependencies**:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ pip install agno openai python-dotenv firecrawl-py pydantic
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 3. **Environment Variables** (&#96;.env&#96; file):
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_key_here
+ FIRECRAWL_API_KEY=your_firecrawl_key_here
+ BRAVE_API_KEY=your_brave_search_key_here
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Setup: City Database (First Time)
+ 
+ Generate the city database for accurate URL matching:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd nerdwallet-tools
+ python create_city_database.py
+ cd ..
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ This creates &#96;data/nerdwallet_cities_comprehensive.json&#96; with 200+ US cities.
+ 
+ ### Run the Application
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Normal mode
+ python 01-agno-coordination.py
+ 
+ # Debug mode (shows detailed agent communication)
+ python 01-agno-coordination.py --debug
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Press &#96;Ctrl+C&#96; to exit at any time.
+ 
+ ### Test Components
+ 
+ Test the cost scraper independently:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd nerdwallet-tools
+ python test_cost_scraper.py
+ cd ..
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Test city matching:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd nerdwallet-tools
+ python city_matcher.py
+ cd ..
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Generated Report
+ 
+ The system automatically saves a comprehensive markdown report to the &#96;reports/&#96; folder:
+ 
+ ### Filename Format
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ {current_city}_to_{desired_city}_{timestamp}_analysis.md
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Example: &#96;new_york_city_to_miami_20251106_143022_analysis.md&#96;
+ 
+ ### Report Structure
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;markdown
+ # Should You Move from [Current] to [Desired]?
+ 
+ ## Report Generated
+ - Date: [timestamp]
+ - Analysis Type: Comprehensive Multi-Agent Analysis (Coordination Pattern)
+ 
+ ## Executive Summary
+ [High-level recommendation with confidence level]
+ 
+ ## Financial Analysis
+ [Cost Analyst&#39;s detailed breakdown with real NerdWallet data]
+ 
+ ## Lifestyle &amp; Culture Analysis
+ [Sentiment Analyst&#39;s assessment of city vibe and livability]
+ 
+ ## Migration Insights
+ [Migration Researcher&#39;s findings from Reddit discussions]
+ 
+ ## Final Recommendation
+ [Detailed justification synthesizing all inputs]
+ 
+ ## Key Supporting Factors
+ - [Bulleted list of reasons to move]
+ 
+ ## Key Concerns
+ - [Bulleted list of potential risks]
+ 
+ ## Next Steps
+ - [Actionable recommendations]
+ 
+ ## Report Metadata
+ - Analysis Pattern: Coordination (Sequential Multi-Agent)
+ - Specialists Consulted: Cost Analyst, Sentiment Analyst, Migration Researcher
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Key Features
+ 
+ ### 1. **Animated UI**
+ - Loading animations during processing
+ - Clear visual feedback for each step
+ - Colorful ASCII art banner
+ - Emoji indicators for tool usage
+ 
+ ### 2. **Intelligent City Matching**
+ - Handles aliases (NYC â†’ New York City)
+ - Borough-specific matching (Manhattan, Brooklyn, etc.)
+ - Fuzzy matching for typos
+ - Fallback to basic formatting if city not in database
+ 
+ ### 3. **Comprehensive Validation**
+ - Ensures all required info before proceeding
+ - Asks targeted follow-up questions
+ - Validates city specificity
+ - Checks for financial context
+ 
+ ### 4. **Real-Time Tool Logging**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ ğŸ” [COST TOOL] Fetching real cost of living data...
+ âœ… [COST TOOL] Successfully retrieved cost of living data!
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 5. **Graceful Error Handling**
+ - Falls back to general knowledge if tools fail
+ - Notes tool failures in analysis
+ - Continues with available data
+ 
+ ## When to Use Coordination Pattern
+ 
+ **Use Coordination Mode when:**
+ - Tasks are independent and don&#39;t require discussion
+ - You want clear, separate analyses from each expert
+ - Sequential processing is acceptable
+ - Synthesis happens at the end without debate
+ - Transparency into individual agent work is valuable
+ 
+ **Consider Cooperation Mode when:**
+ - Decision requires balancing conflicting perspectives
+ - User has a clear priority that should influence all analyses
+ - Debate between agents would add value
+ - Consensus-building is important
+ 
+ ## Technical Implementation
+ 
+ ### Key Code Pattern
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Sequential coordination team
+ move_decision_team = Team(
+     name=&quot;City Move Decision Team&quot;,
+     model=OpenAIChat(&quot;gpt-4o-mini&quot;),
+     members=[cost_analyst, sentiment_analyst, migration_researcher],
+     delegate_task_to_all_members=False,  # â† COORDINATION MODE (default)
+     show_members_responses=True,          # â† Show individual work
+     add_member_tools_to_context=False,    # â† Isolate agent tools
+     output_schema=FinalRecommendation,
+     # ... instructions for delegation flow
+ )
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Team Leader Instructions (Simplified)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ instructions=[
+     &quot;Step 1 - Validate user has ALL required information (cities, financials, preferences)&quot;,
+     &quot;Step 2 - Delegate sequentially: Cost â†’ Sentiment â†’ Migration&quot;,
+     &quot;Step 3 - Synthesize all reports into final recommendation&quot;,
+     &quot;Step 4 - Save comprehensive markdown report to reports/ folder&quot;,
+ ]
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Dependencies
+ 
+ **Core:**
+ - &#96;agno&#96; - Multi-agent orchestration framework
+ - &#96;pydantic&#96; - Data validation and type safety
+ - &#96;python-dotenv&#96; - Environment variable management
+ 
+ **AI Services:**
+ - &#96;openai&#96; - GPT models via OpenAI API
+ 
+ **Data Tools:**
+ - &#96;firecrawl-py&#96; - Web scraping for NerdWallet data
+ - Custom &#96;brave_tools&#96; - Reddit search integration
+ 
+ **Utilities:**
+ - &#96;difflib&#96; - Fuzzy city name matching
+ - &#96;json&#96; - City database management
+ - &#96;threading&#96; - Animated UI
+ 
+ ## Project Files
+ 
+ **Main Script:** &#96;01-agno-coordination.py&#96;
+ 
+ **Supporting Tools:**
+ - &#96;brave_tools/brave_search_tool.py&#96; - Reddit search
+ - &#96;nerdwallet-tools/create_city_database.py&#96; - City database generator
+ - &#96;nerdwallet-tools/city_matcher.py&#96; - Test city matching
+ - &#96;nerdwallet-tools/test_cost_scraper.py&#96; - Test NerdWallet scraping
+ 
+ **Data:**
+ - &#96;data/nerdwallet_cities_comprehensive.json&#96; - City database (200+ cities)
+ 
+ **Reports:**
+ - &#96;reports/&#96; - Auto-generated analysis reports
+ 
+ ## Future Enhancements
+ 
+ ### Potential Improvements
+ - âœ… ~~Real-time cost data~~ (COMPLETED)
+ - âœ… ~~Reddit migration stories~~ (COMPLETED)
+ - ğŸ”„ Sentiment analysis from actual reviews/articles
+ - ğŸ”„ Job market data integration (LinkedIn, Indeed)
+ - ğŸ”„ School ratings and education data
+ - ğŸ”„ Crime statistics and safety metrics
+ - ğŸ”„ Weather and climate data
+ - ğŸ”„ Interactive report format (HTML/dashboard)
+ 
+ ## Comparison with Other Patterns
+ 
+ | Feature | Coordination (01) | Router (02) | Cooperation (03) |
+ |---------|------------------|-------------|------------------|
+ | **Delegation** | Sequential | Single routing | Simultaneous |
+ | **Agent Interaction** | None | None | Discussion/debate |
+ | **Best For** | Independent tasks | Task classification | Conflicting views |
+ | **Processing** | Linear | Selective | Parallel |
+ | **Synthesis** | End-stage | N/A (single agent) | Consensus |
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ **Related Files:**
+ - &#96;01-agno-coordination.py&#96; - This coordination implementation
+ - &#96;02-agno-router.py&#96; - Router pattern (single-agent selection)
+ - &#96;03-agno-cooperation.py&#96; - Cooperation pattern (debate/consensus)
+ - &#96;04-agno-agentos.py&#96; - AgentOS pattern (workflow automation)
+ 
+ **Documentation:**
+ - &#96;COMPARISON.md&#96; - Detailed pattern comparison
+ - &#96;README.md&#96; - Project overview
+ - &#96;agentos-reference/&#96; - AgentOS documentation
+
```

---

## Plan
Created the `01-agno-coordination-approach/` folder with a comprehensive README documenting the coordination pattern.

## Implementation

Created `01-agno-coordination-approach/README.md` with:

**Structure:**
- Overview and key characteristics
- Architecture diagram
- Specialized agent descriptions (Cost Analyst, Sentiment Analyst, Migration Researcher)
- Real data integration details (NerdWallet, Reddit via Brave)
- Information gathering flow with examples
- Pydantic data models
- Complete usage instructions
- Generated report format
- Key features list
- When to use this pattern (vs. other patterns)
- Technical implementation details
- Dependencies and project files
- Comparison table with other patterns

**Key Sections:**
1. **Architecture visualization** showing sequential delegation flow
2. **Agent details** with specific tools and data sources
3. **Real data integration** examples for NerdWallet and Reddit
4. **Setup instructions** including prerequisites, environment variables, and city database
5. **Generated report structure** showing markdown format
6. **Comparison table** contrasting Coordination vs Router vs Cooperation patterns

The README follows the same style and format as the existing approach READMEs (`02-agno-coordination-approach` and `03-agno-cooperation-approach`) to maintain consistency across the project.

```diff
- 
+ # 04 - AgentOS Production Deployment Pattern
+ 
+ ## Overview
+ 
+ This pattern demonstrates how to transform a multi-agent system into a **production-ready application** using AgentOS. It takes the coordination pattern and adds enterprise features like session management, memory persistence, knowledge bases, and web-based deployment.
+ 
+ Think of this as &quot;multi-agent system meets production infrastructure&quot; - your agents become persistent, stateful services accessible via API and web interface.
+ 
+ ## Key Characteristics
+ 
+ - **FastAPI Server**: Agents served via REST API endpoints
+ - **Session Management**: Persistent conversations across interactions
+ - **Memory Persistence**: Agents remember previous discussions
+ - **Knowledge Base**: Vector-embedded documentation and data
+ - **Control Plane**: Web-based management interface
+ - **PostgreSQL Backend**: Database for sessions, memory, and vectors
+ 
+ ## Architecture
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+ â”‚           AgentOS Control Plane (Web UI)                â”‚
+ â”‚         https://app.agno.com                            â”‚
+ â”‚  - Chat interface with agents                           â”‚
+ â”‚  - Session history and management                       â”‚
+ â”‚  - Agent monitoring and metrics                         â”‚
+ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+                           â”‚
+                           â”‚ HTTP/WebSocket
+                           â”‚
+ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+ â”‚        FastAPI Server (localhost:7777)                  â”‚
+ â”‚  - REST API endpoints                                   â”‚
+ â”‚  - Session management                                   â”‚
+ â”‚  - Request routing                                      â”‚
+ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+                           â”‚
+                 â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+                 â”‚                   â”‚
+ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â–¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”   â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â–¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+ â”‚  PostgreSQL DB      â”‚   â”‚  Vector DB         â”‚
+ â”‚  (PgVector)         â”‚   â”‚  (Embeddings)      â”‚
+ â”‚                     â”‚   â”‚                    â”‚
+ â”‚  - agent_sessions   â”‚   â”‚  - agent_knowledge â”‚
+ â”‚  - agent_memory     â”‚   â”‚  - embeddings      â”‚
+ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜   â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+                           â”‚
+                 â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+                 â”‚                   â”‚
+                 â–¼                   â–¼
+ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”   â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
+ â”‚  City Move Decision   â”‚   â”‚  Knowledge Base  â”‚
+ â”‚       Team            â”‚   â”‚                  â”‚
+ â”‚                       â”‚   â”‚  - System docs   â”‚
+ â”‚  Members:             â”‚   â”‚  - City data     â”‚
+ â”‚  - Cost Analyst       â”‚   â”‚  - Reports       â”‚
+ â”‚  - Sentiment Analyst  â”‚   â”‚  - Capabilities  â”‚
+ â”‚  - Migration Researcherâ”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## What AgentOS Adds
+ 
+ ### 1. **Persistence Layer**
+ 
+ **Before (Stateless):**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Each run is independent
+ team = Team(name=&quot;Move Team&quot;, members=[...])
+ team.print_response(&quot;Should I move?&quot;)
+ # No memory of previous conversations
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **After (Stateful with AgentOS):**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Sessions persist across interactions
+ team = Team(
+     name=&quot;Move Team&quot;,
+     db=db,  # PostgreSQL for sessions &amp; memory
+     knowledge=knowledge_base,  # Shared knowledge
+ )
+ # Agents remember previous conversations
+ # Context is maintained across messages
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 2. **Web-Based Interface**
+ 
+ Instead of terminal-only interaction, users can:
+ - Chat via web browser at https://app.agno.com
+ - View conversation history
+ - Switch between agents
+ - Monitor agent status
+ - Access from any device
+ 
+ ### 3. **Knowledge Base Integration**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ relocation_knowledge = Knowledge(
+     vector_db=PgVector(embedder=OpenAIEmbedder())
+ )
+ 
+ # Add system documentation
+ relocation_knowledge.add_text(SYSTEM_DOCS)
+ 
+ # Add data files
+ relocation_knowledge.add_directory(path=&quot;data&quot;, glob=&quot;*.json&quot;)
+ 
+ # Agents can now query this knowledge
+ agent = Agent(
+     knowledge=relocation_knowledge,  # â† Agents have RAG access
+     # ...
+ )
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **What this enables:**
+ - Agents can recall team capabilities
+ - Access to historical reports
+ - City data lookup
+ - Consistent system knowledge across all agents
+ 
+ ### 4. **Session Management**
+ 
+ Each conversation gets a unique session ID:
+ - Users can pause and resume conversations
+ - Context is maintained across messages
+ - Multiple users can have independent sessions
+ - Session history is queryable
+ 
+ ### 5. **API-First Architecture**
+ 
+ The system exposes REST endpoints:
+ - &#96;POST /v1/agents/{agent_id}/runs&#96; - Run an agent
+ - &#96;POST /v1/teams/{team_id}/runs&#96; - Run a team
+ - &#96;GET /v1/sessions/{session_id}&#96; - Get session details
+ - &#96;GET /health&#96; - Health check
+ - Full OpenAPI docs at &#96;/docs&#96;
+ 
+ ## Database Configuration
+ 
+ ### PostgreSQL with PgVector
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ DB_URL = &quot;postgresql+psycopg://agno:agno@localhost:5532/agno&quot;
+ 
+ # Session and memory storage
+ db = PostgresDb(
+     db_url=DB_URL,
+     session_table=&quot;agent_sessions&quot;,
+     memory_table=&quot;agent_memory&quot;,
+ )
+ 
+ # Vector database for knowledge embeddings
+ vector_db = PgVector(
+     table_name=&quot;agent_knowledge&quot;,
+     db_url=DB_URL,
+     embedder=OpenAIEmbedder(id=&quot;text-embedding-3-small&quot;),
+ )
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Tables Created:
+ - &#96;agent_sessions&#96; - Conversation sessions
+ - &#96;agent_memory&#96; - Agent memory storage
+ - &#96;agent_knowledge&#96; - Vector embeddings for RAG
+ 
+ ## Enhanced Agent Configuration
+ 
+ Each agent gets additional capabilities:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ cost_analyst = Agent(
+     name=&quot;Cost Analyst&quot;,
+     id=&quot;cost-analyst&quot;,  # â† Unique ID for routing
+     db=db,              # â† Enable session storage
+     knowledge=relocation_knowledge,  # â† Access to knowledge base
+     # ... rest of configuration
+ )
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **New capabilities per agent:**
+ - **Memory**: Recall facts from earlier in conversation
+ - **Knowledge Access**: Query embedded documents via RAG
+ - **Session Context**: Understand conversation history
+ - **Unique ID**: Addressable via API
+ 
+ ## AgentOS Instance
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ from agno.os import AgentOS
+ 
+ agent_os = AgentOS(
+     id=&quot;should-i-move-os&quot;,
+     description=&quot;City Relocation Analysis System&quot;,
+     agents=[cost_analyst, sentiment_analyst, migration_researcher],
+     teams=[move_decision_team],
+     knowledge=[relocation_knowledge],
+ )
+ 
+ # Get FastAPI app
+ app = agent_os.get_app()
+ 
+ # Serve with uvicorn
+ agent_os.serve(
+     app=&quot;04-agno-agentos:app&quot;,
+     host=&quot;0.0.0.0&quot;,
+     port=7777,
+     reload=True,
+ )
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Setup and Installation
+ 
+ ### Prerequisites
+ 
+ 1. **Docker** (for PostgreSQL with PgVector)
+ 2. **Python 3.10+**
+ 3. **Required API Keys**:
+    - OpenAI API key
+    - Firecrawl API key
+    - Brave Search API key
+ 
+ ### Step 1: Environment Variables
+ 
+ Create &#96;.env&#96; file:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # OpenAI
+ OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_key_here
+ 
+ # Data sources
+ FIRECRAWL_API_KEY=your_firecrawl_key_here
+ BRAVE_API_KEY=your_brave_search_key_here
+ 
+ # Database (or use default)
+ AGENTOS_DB_URL=postgresql+psycopg://agno:agno@localhost:5532/agno
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Step 2: Start PostgreSQL Database
+ 
+ **Using Docker:**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ docker run -d \
+   --name pgvector-db \
+   -e POSTGRES_USER=agno \
+   -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=agno \
+   -e POSTGRES_DB=agno \
+   -p 5532:5432 \
+   pgvector/pgvector:pg16
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Verify connection:**
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno -c &quot;SELECT version();&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Step 3: Install Dependencies
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Activate virtual environment
+ source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
+ 
+ # Install AgentOS requirements
+ pip install -r requirements-agentos.txt
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Key packages:**
+ - &#96;agno[agentos]&#96; - AgentOS framework
+ - &#96;psycopg[binary]&#96; - PostgreSQL driver
+ - &#96;pgvector&#96; - Vector extension for PostgreSQL
+ 
+ ### Step 4: Setup City Database
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd nerdwallet-tools
+ python create_city_database.py
+ cd ..
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Step 5: Start AgentOS Server
+ 
+ **Windows:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ start-agentos.bat
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Linux/Mac:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ chmod +x start-agentos.sh
+ ./start-agentos.sh
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Or directly:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ python 04-agno-agentos.py
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ You should see:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ ğŸš€ Starting AgentOS for &#39;Should I Move?&#39; Application
+ ================================================================================
+ 
+ ğŸ“‹ Available Resources:
+    - ğŸ‘¥ Agents: Cost Analyst, Sentiment Analyst, Migration Researcher
+    - ğŸ¤ Team: City Move Decision Team (coordinator)
+    - ğŸ§  Knowledge Base: System docs, team capabilities, city data
+ 
+ ğŸŒ Server Information:
+    - Local URL: http://localhost:7777
+    - API Docs: http://localhost:7777/docs
+    - Health Check: http://localhost:7777/health
+ 
+ ğŸ”— Next Steps:
+    1. Visit https://app.agno.com to access the Control Plane
+    2. Click &#39;Connect AgentOS&#39; and enter: http://localhost:7777
+    3. Start chatting with your agents through the web interface!
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Step 6: Connect to Control Plane
+ 
+ 1. **Open browser** â†’ https://app.agno.com
+ 2. **Click &quot;Connect AgentOS&quot;**
+ 3. **Enter URL**: &#96;http://localhost:7777&#96;
+ 4. **Start chatting** with your agents!
+ 
+ ## Usage
+ 
+ ### Via Control Plane (Web UI)
+ 
+ 1. Navigate to https://app.agno.com
+ 2. Select &quot;City Move Decision Team&quot; from the agent list
+ 3. Start a conversation:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+    You: Should I move from Austin to Seattle?
+    
+    Team: I&#39;d be happy to help you analyze that move! To provide a 
+          comprehensive recommendation, I&#39;ll need to understand your 
+          situation better. Can you share:
+          
+          1. What&#39;s driving your interest in Seattle?
+          2. What&#39;s your approximate household income and monthly budget?
+          3. What do you value most in a city?
+    
+    You: [Continue conversation...]
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Features:**
+ - Natural multi-turn conversations
+ - Team remembers context from earlier messages
+ - Can ask clarifying questions at any point
+ - Real-time delegation to specialized agents visible
+ - Final report is saved and accessible
+ 
+ ### Via API (cURL Example)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ curl -X POST &quot;http://localhost:7777/v1/teams/move-decision-team/runs&quot; \
+   -H &quot;Content-Type: application/json&quot; \
+   -d &#39;{
+     &quot;message&quot;: &quot;Should I move from Austin to Seattle? I make $150k/year and value outdoor activities.&quot;
+   }&#39;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Via Python SDK
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ import requests
+ 
+ response = requests.post(
+     &quot;http://localhost:7777/v1/teams/move-decision-team/runs&quot;,
+     json={
+         &quot;message&quot;: &quot;Should I move from Austin to Seattle?&quot;,
+         &quot;session_id&quot;: &quot;user-123&quot;  # Optional: for session continuity
+     }
+ )
+ 
+ result = response.json()
+ print(result[&quot;content&quot;])
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Conversation Flow with Memory
+ 
+ ### First Message:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ User: I&#39;m thinking about moving to Miami
+ 
+ Team: Great! Let me help you analyze that move. Where are you 
+       currently living?
+ 
+ [Session ID created: sess_abc123]
+ [Memory stored: User considering Miami move]
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Second Message (Same Session):
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ User: I&#39;m in Boston
+ 
+ Team: Got it - Boston to Miami! That&#39;s quite a change. Since 
+       I remember you&#39;re interested in Miami, can you share what&#39;s 
+       driving this consideration?
+ 
+ [Memory retrieved: Previous context about Miami]
+ [Memory stored: Current city = Boston, Desired = Miami]
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Third Message:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ User: I&#39;m tired of the cold winters
+ 
+ Team: That makes sense - Miami certainly offers a warm climate! 
+       Let me gather some more details about your financial situation...
+ 
+ [Memory retrieved: Boston â†’ Miami, reason = cold winters]
+ [Continues conversation with full context]
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Knowledge Base Features
+ 
+ ### What&#39;s in the Knowledge Base?
+ 
+ 1. **System Documentation** (embedded at startup):
+    - Team structure and roles
+    - Agent capabilities
+    - Tool descriptions
+    - Conversation flow
+    
+ 2. **City Data** (from &#96;data/&#96; directory):
+    - NerdWallet city database
+    - Historical comparison data
+ 
+ 3. **Dynamic Content**:
+    - Previous analysis reports (can be added)
+    - User feedback and insights
+ 
+ ### How Agents Use It
+ 
+ Agents can query the knowledge base during conversations:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Agent instruction example:
+ &quot;If asked about your capabilities, reference the knowledge base 
+  for team member details&quot;
+ 
+ # At runtime:
+ User: What can the Cost Analyst do?
+ 
+ Agent: [Queries knowledge base]
+        The Cost Analyst specializes in financial analysis using 
+        real-time NerdWallet data, covering housing costs, 
+        transportation, food prices, and tax implications...
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Benefits:
+ - Consistent answers about system capabilities
+ - Access to historical data
+ - Reduced hallucinations about team structure
+ - Can cite specific documentation
+ 
+ ## Enhanced Instructions
+ 
+ All agents have production-grade instructions:
+ 
+ ### Team Leader Example:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ instructions=[
+     &quot;ğŸ¤ YOUR ROLE:&quot;,
+     &quot;- Engage in natural, helpful conversations&quot;,
+     &quot;- Ask clarifying questions when needed&quot;,
+     &quot;- Coordinate specialists to provide analysis&quot;,
+     
+     &quot;ğŸ’¬ CONVERSATIONAL APPROACH:&quot;,
+     &quot;- Be warm and empathetic&quot;,
+     &quot;- Remember context from earlier messages&quot;,  # â† Memory!
+     &quot;- Explain what your team will do&quot;,
+     
+     &quot;ğŸ§  REMEMBER:&quot;,
+     &quot;- You have access to a knowledge base&quot;,      # â† RAG!
+     &quot;- You maintain conversation memory&quot;,         # â† Sessions!
+ ]
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Monitoring and Observability
+ 
+ ### Health Check
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ curl http://localhost:7777/health
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Response:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;json
+ {
+   &quot;status&quot;: &quot;healthy&quot;,
+   &quot;timestamp&quot;: &quot;2025-11-06T21:30:00Z&quot;,
+   &quot;agents&quot;: [&quot;cost-analyst&quot;, &quot;sentiment-analyst&quot;, &quot;migration-researcher&quot;],
+   &quot;teams&quot;: [&quot;move-decision-team&quot;]
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### API Documentation
+ 
+ Visit http://localhost:7777/docs for:
+ - Interactive API testing
+ - Schema documentation
+ - Example requests/responses
+ - Authentication details (if configured)
+ 
+ ### Database Inspection
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Check sessions
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno \
+   -c &quot;SELECT id, created_at FROM agent_sessions ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 5;&quot;
+ 
+ # Check memory entries
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno \
+   -c &quot;SELECT session_id, created_at FROM agent_memory ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 5;&quot;
+ 
+ # Check knowledge embeddings
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno \
+   -c &quot;SELECT COUNT(*) FROM agent_knowledge;&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Generated Reports
+ 
+ Reports are still saved to &#96;reports/&#96; folder as markdown files:
+ 
+ **Filename format:** &#96;{current_city}_to_{desired_city}_{timestamp}_analysis.md&#96;
+ 
+ **Enhanced with:**
+ - Session ID for traceability
+ - Conversation history context
+ - Knowledge base references (if used)
+ - Memory snapshots
+ 
+ ## Comparison: Terminal vs AgentOS
+ 
+ | Feature | Terminal (01-03) | AgentOS (04) |
+ |---------|-----------------|--------------|
+ | **Interface** | Command line only | Web UI + API |
+ | **State** | Stateless | Session-based |
+ | **Memory** | None | Persistent |
+ | **Knowledge** | None | Vector RAG |
+ | **Multi-user** | No | Yes |
+ | **API Access** | No | REST API |
+ | **Deployment** | Local script | Server/production |
+ | **Monitoring** | Console logs | Metrics + logs |
+ | **Database** | None | PostgreSQL |
+ 
+ ## When to Use AgentOS Pattern
+ 
+ **Use AgentOS when:**
+ - Building production applications
+ - Need multi-user support
+ - Want persistent conversations
+ - Require API access
+ - Building web applications
+ - Need monitoring and observability
+ - Want session management
+ - Need knowledge base integration
+ 
+ **Use Terminal patterns when:**
+ - Quick prototyping
+ - Single-user local tool
+ - No persistence needed
+ - Simplicity is priority
+ - No server infrastructure
+ 
+ ## Deployment Options
+ 
+ ### Local Development
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ python 04-agno-agentos.py
+ # Runs on localhost:7777
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Production Deployment
+ 
+ **1. Docker Compose:**
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;yaml
+ version: &#39;3.8&#39;
+ services:
+   postgres:
+     image: pgvector/pgvector:pg16
+     environment:
+       POSTGRES_USER: agno
+       POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD}
+       POSTGRES_DB: agno
+     volumes:
+       - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql/data
+     
+   agentos:
+     build: .
+     environment:
+       AGENTOS_DB_URL: postgresql+psycopg://agno:${DB_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/agno
+       OPENAI_API_KEY: ${OPENAI_API_KEY}
+     ports:
+       - &quot;7777:7777&quot;
+     depends_on:
+       - postgres
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **2. Cloud Deployment (e.g., AWS/GCP/Azure):**
+ - Deploy PostgreSQL as managed service (RDS, Cloud SQL)
+ - Deploy FastAPI app to container service (ECS, Cloud Run, AKS)
+ - Configure environment variables
+ - Set up load balancer for API endpoints
+ - Enable SSL/TLS for production
+ 
+ **3. Kubernetes:**
+ - Deploy as StatefulSet (for database)
+ - Deploy FastAPI as Deployment
+ - Use ConfigMaps for configuration
+ - Use Secrets for API keys
+ - Add HPA for auto-scaling
+ 
+ ## Troubleshooting
+ 
+ ### Database Connection Issues
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Test database connection
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno -c &quot;SELECT 1;&quot;
+ 
+ # Check if PgVector extension is enabled
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno -c &quot;CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS vector;&quot;
+ 
+ # Verify tables exist
+ docker exec -it pgvector-db psql -U agno -d agno -c &quot;\dt&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Server Won&#39;t Start
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Check if port 7777 is already in use
+ netstat -ano | findstr :7777  # Windows
+ lsof -i :7777                  # Linux/Mac
+ 
+ # Check environment variables
+ python -c &quot;from dotenv import load_dotenv; load_dotenv(); import os; print(os.getenv(&#39;AGENTOS_DB_URL&#39;))&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Knowledge Base Not Loading
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Verify data directory exists
+ ls -la data/
+ 
+ # Check file permissions
+ chmod 644 data/*.json
+ 
+ # Test manual knowledge loading
+ python -c &quot;
+ from agno.knowledge.knowledge import Knowledge
+ from agno.vectordb.pgvector import PgVector
+ kb = Knowledge(vector_db=PgVector(...))
+ kb.add_directory(&#39;data&#39;, glob=&#39;*.json&#39;)
+ &quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Advanced Features
+ 
+ ### Custom Knowledge Sources
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Add web content to knowledge base
+ relocation_knowledge.add_url(
+     url=&quot;https://example.com/city-guide&quot;,
+     title=&quot;City Moving Guide&quot;
+ )
+ 
+ # Add PDF documents
+ relocation_knowledge.add_pdf(
+     path=&quot;docs/relocation-handbook.pdf&quot;,
+     title=&quot;Relocation Handbook&quot;
+ )
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Session Management
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Get session history
+ from agno.db.postgres import PostgresDb
+ 
+ db = PostgresDb(db_url=DB_URL)
+ sessions = db.get_sessions(agent_id=&quot;move-decision-team&quot;)
+ 
+ for session in sessions:
+     print(f&quot;Session {session.id}: {session.created_at}&quot;)
+     messages = db.get_memory(session_id=session.id)
+     for msg in messages:
+         print(f&quot;  {msg.role}: {msg.content[:50]}...&quot;)
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Agent Metrics
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;python
+ # Track agent performance
+ @app.middleware(&quot;http&quot;)
+ async def track_metrics(request, call_next):
+     start_time = time.time()
+     response = await call_next(request)
+     duration = time.time() - start_time
+     
+     # Log metrics
+     print(f&quot;Request to {request.url.path} took {duration:.2f}s&quot;)
+     
+     return response
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Project Files
+ 
+ **Main Script:** &#96;04-agno-agentos.py&#96;
+ 
+ **Configuration:**
+ - &#96;.env&#96; - Environment variables
+ - &#96;requirements-agentos.txt&#96; - Python dependencies
+ - &#96;start-agentos.sh&#96; / &#96;start-agentos.bat&#96; - Launch scripts
+ 
+ **Documentation:**
+ - &#96;agentos-reference/README.md&#96; - AgentOS overview
+ - &#96;agentos-reference/ARCHITECTURE.md&#96; - Detailed architecture
+ - &#96;agentos-reference/GETTING_STARTED.md&#96; - Setup guide
+ 
+ ## Future Enhancements
+ 
+ ### Potential Additions:
+ - ğŸ”„ Authentication and authorization (JWT, OAuth)
+ - ğŸ”„ Rate limiting and quotas per user
+ - ğŸ”„ WebSocket support for streaming responses
+ - ğŸ”„ Advanced analytics dashboard
+ - ğŸ”„ A/B testing for agent instructions
+ - ğŸ”„ Feedback collection and learning
+ - ğŸ”„ Multi-language support
+ - ğŸ”„ Export conversation transcripts
+ - ğŸ”„ Admin panel for knowledge base management
+ 
+ ## Key Takeaways
+ 
+ **AgentOS transforms your agents into:**
+ 1. **Stateful Services** - Remember conversations and context
+ 2. **API-First** - Accessible via REST endpoints
+ 3. **Production-Ready** - With monitoring, persistence, and scalability
+ 4. **Knowledge-Enabled** - With RAG access to documentation
+ 5. **Web-Accessible** - Through the Control Plane UI
+ 6. **Multi-User** - Supporting concurrent sessions
+ 
+ **Bottom line:** If you need to deploy agents as a service, AgentOS provides the infrastructure layer you need.
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ **Related Files:**
+ - &#96;04-agno-agentos.py&#96; - This AgentOS implementation
+ - &#96;01-agno-coordination.py&#96; - Terminal coordination pattern (stateless)
+ - &#96;03-agno-cooperation.py&#96; - Terminal cooperation pattern (stateless)
+ - &#96;agentos-reference/&#96; - Full AgentOS documentation
+ 
+ **External Resources:**
+ - AgentOS Control Plane: https://app.agno.com
+ - Agno Documentation: https://docs.agno.com
+ - PgVector: https://github.com/pgvector/pgvector
+ 
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

## Plan
Created `04-agno-agentos-approach/` folder with comprehensive README documenting the AgentOS production deployment pattern.

## Implementation

Created `04-agno-agentos-approach/README.md` with:

**Core Sections:**
1. **Overview** - Production-ready transformation using AgentOS
2. **Architecture diagram** - Shows FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Control Plane, and vector DB
3. **What AgentOS Adds** - Comparison of before/after with code examples
4. **Database Configuration** - PostgreSQL + PgVector setup
5. **Enhanced Agent Configuration** - Memory, knowledge, and session features
6. **Setup and Installation** - Complete step-by-step guide:
   - Docker PostgreSQL setup
   - Environment variables
   - Dependencies installation
   - City database setup
   - Server startup
   - Control Plane connection
7. **Usage Examples** - Web UI, API, and Python SDK
8. **Conversation Flow with Memory** - Multi-turn examples showing persistence
9. **Knowledge Base Features** - RAG capabilities and content
10. **Monitoring and Observability** - Health checks, API docs, DB inspection
11. **Comparison table** - Terminal vs AgentOS features
12. **Deployment Options** - Local, Docker Compose, Cloud, Kubernetes
13. **Troubleshooting** - Common issues and solutions
14. **Advanced Features** - Custom knowledge, session management, metrics

**Key Highlights:**
- **Production Infrastructure**: FastAPI server, PostgreSQL database, session management
- **Stateful Conversations**: Memory persistence across interactions
- **Knowledge Base**: Vector-embedded RAG for system documentation and city data
- **Web Interface**: Control Plane at app.agno.com for browser-based interaction
- **API-First**: REST endpoints for programmatic access
- **Multi-User Support**: Concurrent sessions with isolation
